radiographic_examinations.findings: A post-contrast hypointense lesion in the anterior pituitary, radiologically consistent with a microadenoma.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Confirmed the hypointensity at 6 years, 8 months of age, which is radiologically consistent with a microadenoma leading to the appearance of an enlarged anterior pituitary.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Normal alignment and configuration of the cervical spine without any apparent structural abnormalities.
